meanings.definition: Engaged in a combat or competition on horseback with lances
meanings.sent1: The knights wore shining armor for the jousted event.
meanings.sent2: The jousting tournament was filled with excitement.
meanings.sent3: The horses looked funny with the jousted lances on their backs.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, competitors jousted for the top spot.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the jousted lances clashing echoed through the arena.

meanings.definition: Took part in a mock combat or competition
meanings.sent1: She jousted with her brother playfully in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The two friends jousted with foam swords at the park.
meanings.sent3: The cats jousted over a toy mouse, pretending it was a real prey.
meanings.sent4: The comedians jousted with witty remarks during the show.
meanings.sent5: The children jousted with laughter as they played together.

meanings.definition: Engaged in a spirited competition or debate
meanings.sent1: The jousted teams displayed great sportsmanship throughout the match.
meanings.sent2: The students jousted in a friendly debate about their favorite books.
meanings.sent3: The siblings jousted over who would get the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The politicians jousted fiercely during the election campaign.
meanings.sent5: The jousted arguments in the courtroom captivated the audience.
